org.apache.distributedlog.lock

Class NopDistributedLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.distributedlog.lock.NopDistributedLock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsyncCloseable, DistributedLock

    public class NopDistributedLock
extends Object
implements DistributedLock
    An implementation of DistributedLock which does nothing.

      • checkOwnershipAndReacquire

        public void checkOwnershipAndReacquire()
                                throws LockingException
        Description copied from interface: DistributedLock
        Check if hold lock. If it doesn't, then re-acquire the lock.
        Specified by:
        checkOwnershipAndReacquire in interface DistributedLock
        Throws:
        LockingException - if the lock attempt fails
        See Also:
        DistributedLock.checkOwnership()

      • checkOwnership

        public void checkOwnership()
                    throws LockingException
        Description copied from interface: DistributedLock
        Check if the lock is held. If not, error out and do not re-acquire. Use this in cases where there are many waiters by default and re-acquire is unlikely to succeed.
        Specified by:
        checkOwnership in interface DistributedLock
        Throws:
        LockingException - if we lost the ownership
        See Also:
        DistributedLock.checkOwnershipAndReacquire()

      • asyncClose

        public CompletableFuture<Void> asyncClose()
        Description copied from interface: AsyncCloseable
        Closes this source and releases any system resources associated with it. If the source is already closed then invoking this method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        asyncClose in interface AsyncCloseable
        Returns:
        future representing the close result.
